description: North Macedonia closed schools for two weeks.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)

description: North Macedonia closed schools for two weeks.
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)

description: North Macedonia changed the hours of curfew for different segments of society. Adults over age 67 are allowed out between 5AM and 11AM. Individuals under 18 years old are allowed out from 12PM to 8PM. Everyone is restricted from movement outside their homes from 9PM to 5AM starting on March 24th.

North Macedonia changed the hours of curfew for different segments of society. Adults over age 67 are allowed out between 5AM and 11AM. Individuals under 18 years old are allowed out from 12PM to 8PM. Everyone is restricted from movement outside their homes from 9PM to 5AM starting on March 24th. UPDATE: Curfew hours were changed. Individuals over 67 years old are allowed outside their houses between 5AM and 11AM. Individuals under 18 years old are allowed outside their houses between 12PM and 9PM only. No one is allowed outside their houses from 9PM to 5AM.
North Macedonia changed curfew times for Saturday and Sunday from 9PM to 5AM to 4PM to 5AM starting on March 28th.

North Macedonia changed curfew times for Saturday and Sunday from 9PM to 5AM to 4PM to 5AM starting on March 28th. UPDATE: Quarantine will be 4PM to 5AM on Saturdays and Sundays starting on March 28th.

On April 8, curfew hours were extended in the municipality of Kumanovo in North Macedonia and the surrounding villages to limit the spread of the coronavirus in the region. From Monday to Friday, individuals are prohibited from leaving their homes between 16:00 and 05:00 (local time). Over the weekend, a complete ban on movement will be implemented from 21:00 on Friday through 05:00 on Monday.
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country

description: North Macedonia is changing weekly curfew hours starting on April 8th. Individuals over 67 years of age can leave their houses from 10AM to 12PM. Individuals under 18 years of age, will be aloud outside their houses from 1PM to 3PM. All other adults will have a curfew of 4PM to 5AM.

North Macedonia is changing weekly curfew hours starting on April 8th. Individuals over 67 years of age can leave their houses from 10AM to 12PM. Individuals under 18 years of age, will be aloud outside their houses from 1PM to 3PM. All other adults will have a curfew of 4PM to 5AM.

North Macedonia is enforcing a weekend curfew starting on Friday April 10th. Curfew will extend from Fridays at 4PM until Monday mornings at 5AM. UPDATE: A weekend curfew has been set from Fridays at 4PM until Mondays at 5AM.

North Macedonia will be relaxing curfew restrictions from May 1st through 3rd. New curfew hours will be from 2PM until 5AM on the next day. Adults over 67 years old can move from 5AM to 11AM. Children up to age 18 can leave their houses from 12PM to 2PM. UPDATE: North Macedonia will be relaxing curfew hours during the May 1st holidays.
North Macedonian authorities have issued a daily nationwide curfew which is now in place between the hours of 19:00 and 05:00 on May 15.
During the public holiday weekend from 23-25 May, in North Macedonia, curfew will face modifications: on 24 May, curfew hours will begin at 11.00 and will end on 26 May at 05.00.

From March 26, North Macedonia will resume to regular curfews: A curfew is in place from 19.00 to 05.00. On Saturdays and Sundays, those older than 67 can only move between 05.00 and 12.00 and those younger than 18 from 13.00 to 19.00.

From March 26, North Macedonia will resume to regular curfews: A curfew is in place from 19.00 to 05.00. On Saturdays and Sundays, those older than 67 can only move between 05.00 and 12.00 and those younger than 18 from 13.00 to 19.00. UPDATE: National curfew lifted. On Wednesday, May 27, the nationwide curfew in place amid the ongoing coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic was ended.
Except Skopje, all other municipalities in North Macedonia, a curfew has been implemented from 9:00 pm, June 4 until 5:00 am, June 5.
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country

description: On June 5, 6, and 7, in North Macedonia, curfew hours will last from 4:00 pm until 5:00 am the following day.
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country

description: The Country of North Macedonia issued a state of emergency for 30 days starting on March 18th, 2020.
The Country of North Macedonia issued a state of emergency for at least 30 days starting on March 18th, 2020. UPDATE: The state of emergency since March 18 was ended on June 12.
North Macedonia’s president has declared an eight-day state of emergency from June 16.
North Macedonia’s president has declared an eight-day state of emergency from June 16. UPDATE: States of emergency was extended until August 31, 2020.
North Macedonia closed the airport and all international borders on March 18th.
North Macedonia will be using a contact tracing app to identify people who have come in contact with an individual who tests positive for Covid-19.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: North Macedonia is mandating that all residents wear masks when they are outside their homes and cannot maintain a 2 meter social distance.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: North Macedonia will have a lockdown from Friday April 17th until Tuesday April 21st.

description: North Macedonia relaxing weekend quarantine hours. Now the hours will be 3PM on Saturdays until 5AM on Mondays. UPDATE: North Macedonia is relaxing quarantine times to 3PM on Saturdays to 5AM on Mondays.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: Government of North Macedonia has ordered a full 80-hour lockdown of the capital Skopje, and the towns of Tetovo, Kumanovo and Štip from Jun 4.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: North Macedonia's Ministry of Health should establish a permanent public information center, which aims to collect all relevant information in order to inform the public about the prevention of coronavirus, as well as the treatment of the virus.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: North Macedonia  began mandating a 14 day self-isolation for all passengers arriving from high to mid risky states.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: North Macedonia began enforcing a closing time of 6PM for all cafes, casinos, and gyms on March 12th.

North Macedonia began enforcing a closing time of 6PM for all cafes, casinos, and gyms on March 12th. UPDATE: All cafes, casinos, and gyms were closed before, but now restaurants and bars with outdoor seating were permitted to open beginning May 28, 2020 under specific protocols determined by the Government of North Macedonia.

North Macedonia began enforcing a closing time of 6PM for all cafes, casinos, and gyms on March 12th. UPDATE: On June 26, 2020, the indoor areas of bars and restaurants, along with gyms, are permitted to operate while implementing specific protocols.
North Macedonia banned all mass gatherings over 1,000. All sporting events are to be played indoors without an audience.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description: North Macedonia banned all public and private gatherings regardless of the size starting on March 12th. UPDATE: All public and private gatherings are prohibited regardless of the size.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description: North Macedonia banned all concerts, performances, and movie showings on March 12th.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description: Gathering in public places is permitted while practicing social distancing and wearing protective masks.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description: In North Macedonia, from Apr 29, individuals must practice two-meter social distancing in public and wear a protective face covering in closed public spaces, including markets, shops, banks, post offices, health facilities, and public transport, as well as in open spaces where it is not possible to maintain a two-meter distance.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

description: In North Macedonia, from Apr 29, individuals must practice two-meter social distancing in public and wear a protective face covering in closed public spaces, including markets, shops, banks, post offices, health facilities, and public transport, as well as in open spaces where it is not possible to maintain a two-meter distance.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
